qas.question: What does the rejection of instruments in Christian music likely stem from?
During what time is there no record of Christians using instruments for worship?
At what point did instruments begin to receive condemnation from Christians?
For what reason do modern Christians continue to oppose the use of instruments?

answers.text: Church Fathers had a better understanding of God's desire for the church

qas.question: What scriptures make negative judgments about instruments?
What scriptures does opposition to instruments come from?
During what time is there evidence of Christians using instruments for worship?
What did Christians condone starting in the 2nd century?
Whose teachings are in line with today's opposition to instruments?
During what time period was opposition to instruments being used in all settings discovered?
Where does rejection of using instruments according to God's will come from?
When is information about the use of instruments for Christian worship written?
What did Christians condemn from 33 AD to 180 AD?

plausible_answers.text: a better understanding of God's desire for the church

qas.question: What do Church Fathers believe today about using instruments?

context: Those who subscribe to this interpretation believe that since the <b4_0><b5_0>Christian<b4_0/> scriptures<b5_0/> never counter instrumental language with any negative judgment on instruments, opposition to instruments instead comes from <a0_0><b10_0>an interpretation of history<b10_0/><a0_0/>. There is no written opposition to musical instruments in any setting in the first century and a half of Christian churches <b9_0><b11_0>(<a1_0><b6_0>33 AD to 180AD<b6_0/><a1_0/>)<b11_0/><b9_0/>. The use of instruments for Christian worship during this period is also undocumented. Toward the end of <a2_0>the 2nd century<a2_0/>, Christians began condemning <b12_0>the <b7_0>instruments themselves<b12_0/><b7_0/>. Those who oppose instruments today believe these <a3_0>Church Fathers had <b13_0>a better understanding of God's desire for the church<b13_0/><a3_0/>,[citation needed] but there are significant differences between the teachings of these <b8_0>Church Fathers<b8_0/> and Christian opposition to instruments today.
